summary: Implements a responsive timer screen with event selector, official cubing.js (CDN) scramble generation, a TwistyPlayer-based visualization panel, WCA-style space/touch hold controls, and a custom orange/amber theme. However, the event list is incomplete vs. “all official WCA events”, and visualization fallback/unsupported-event handling is not clearly implemented (it defaults to 3x3). Also includes Internet Identity/auth scaffolding that was explicitly a non-goal.

missing_requirements.requirement: Event selector includes all official WCA events (one entry per event), with English names, and drives scramble generation/visualization for the selected event.
missing_requirements.reason: The provided WCA_EVENTS list only contains a subset of official events (e.g., it includes 333, 222, 444... plus some BLD/FMC/OH, but does not show the full current WCA set). From the diff summary alone, it does not satisfy “all official WCA events”.

missing_requirements.requirement: If an event does not support a visualization, show a clear English fallback message (e.g., "No visualization available for this event").
missing_requirements.reason: ScrambleVisualizer always maps unknown/unsupported eventIds to a default puzzleName of '3x3x3' rather than detecting unsupported events and showing a fallback. The fallback message only appears on exceptions, not on unsupported events.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity / authenticated-vs-anonymous actor plumbing (InternetIdentityProvider usage and identity-aware useActor hook).
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest non-goals explicitly exclude implementing user accounts/auth flows/Internet Identity login UX; the timer app requirements are entirely frontend timer/scramble related. The diff adds/uses Internet Identity and actor fetching logic anyway.

hallucinated_features.description: GitHub link in header pointing to cubing.js repository.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested in any requirement or acceptance criteria.
